titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 12 Motion to Extend as to Rufino J. Villarreal. Pretrial Motion Deadline set for May 4, 2007. Thalken.(MLF, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Villarreal
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 21 Oral Motion as to Rufino J. Villarreal; Villareal shall have to on or before July 13, 2007, in which to file pretrial motions in accordance with the progression order; Trial of this matter is continued to October 30, 2007; the additional time arising as a result of the granting of the motion, i.e., from June 6, 2007 through October 30, 2007, shall be deemed excludable time under the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken.(PCV, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting 21 Oral Motion as to Rufino J. Ordered by Magistrate Judge Thomas D. Thalken.(PCV, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Villarreal
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting in part 24 Motion to Continue Trial as to Rufino J. Villarreal (1). Non-Jury Trial set for 12/18/2007 at 9:00 AM in Courtroom 2 (Omaha) before Judge Laurie Smith Camp. Ordered by Judge F. A. Gossett. (CLS, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting in part 24 Motion to Continue Trial as to Rufino J. Villarreal (1). Non-Jury Trial set for 12/18/2007 at 9:00 AM in Courtroom 2 (Omaha) before Judge Laurie Smith Camp. Ordered by Judge F. A. Gossett. (CLS, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Villarreal
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting in part and denying in part 26 Motion to Modify Conditions of Release; Villareal's request for modification of the release order as it applies to paragraph 7(d) will be granted and he is relieved of the requirement to maintain or seek employment as a condition of his pretrial release; Villareal's request to modify the requirement in condition 7(m) that he refrain from the use of any alcohol will be denied as to Rufino J. Villarreal. Ordered by Judge Thomas D. Thalken.(PCV)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting in part and denying in part 26 Motion to Modify Conditions of Release; Villareal's request for modification of the release order as it applies to paragraph 7(d) will be granted and he is relieved of the requirement to maintain or seek employment as a condition of his pretrial release; Villareal's request to modify the requirement in condition 7(m) that he refrain from the use of any alcohol will be denied as to Rufino J. Villarreal. Ordered by Judge Thomas D. Thalken.(PCV)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Villarreal
titleInfo.subTitle: FINDINGS OF FACT AND CONCLUSIONS OF LAW as to defendant Rufino J. Villarreal. The Defendant, Rufino Villarreal, is not guilty of the charges set forth in Counts II, III, IV, V and VI of the Superseding Indictment. The Indictment and Superseding Indictment are dismissed. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (JAE, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: FINDINGS OF FACT AND CONCLUSIONS OF LAW as to defendant Rufino J. Villarreal. The Defendant, Rufino Villarreal, is not guilty of the charges set forth in Counts II, III, IV, V and VI of the Superseding Indictment. The Indictment and Superseding Indictment are dismissed. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (JAE, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Villarreal
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT that in accordance with the Court's Findings of Fact and Conclusions of Law, IT IS ORDERED that the Defendant, Rufino Villarreal, is not guilty of the charges set forth in Counts II, III, IV, V and VI of the Superseding Indictment; and the Indictment and Superseding Indictment are dismissed as to defendant Rufino J. Villarreal. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (1 certified copy to USM)(CJP)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT that in accordance with the Court's Findings of Fact and Conclusions of Law, IT IS ORDERED that the Defendant, Rufino Villarreal, is not guilty of the charges set forth in Counts II, III, IV, V and VI of the Superseding Indictment; and the Indictment and Superseding Indictment are dismissed as to defendant Rufino J. Villarreal. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (1 certified copy to USM)(CJP)
